frames.timing

Class AnimatorObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • frames.timing.AnimatorObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Animator

    public class AnimatorObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements Animator
    Class implementing the main Animator behavior.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AnimatorObject(TimingHandler handler)
      Constructs an animated object with a default period() of 40 milliseconds (25Hz).

    • Method Summary

      • timer

        public SequentialTimer timer()
        Description copied from interface: Animator
        Returns the sequential timer.
        Specified by:
        timer in interface Animator

      • started

        public boolean started()
        Return true when the animation loop is started.

        The timing handler will check when started() and then called the animation callback method every period() milliseconds.

        Use start() and stop().

        Specified by:
        started in interface Animator
        See Also:
        start(), animate()

      • period

        public long period()
        The animation loop period, in milliseconds. When started(), this is the delay that takes place between two consecutive iterations of the animation loop.

        This delay defines a target frame rate that will only be achieved if your animate() methods is fast enough.

        Default value is 40 milliseconds (25 Hz).

        Specified by:
        period in interface Animator
        See Also:
        setPeriod(long)

      • setPeriod

        public void setPeriod(long period)
        Description copied from interface: Animator
        Sets the animation period in milliseconds. Restarts the animation if it already Animator.started().
        Specified by:
        setPeriod in interface Animator

      • restart

        public void restart()
        Restart the animation.

        Simply calls stop() and then start().

        Specified by:
        restart in interface Animator

        Description copied from interface: Animator
